title: What to do if you receive a complaint
steps: If you receive a complaint from a customer you may advise them that this is a women's right under Australian Federal Law.
If you are uncomfortable, unsure, or if the complaint escalates seek help from your Store Manager.
examples: Sometimes, other customers will take offence to seeing a mother breastfeeding or expressing in one of our stores.
bestPractice: Seek help from your Store Manager if you are unsure.
constraints: No one should ever be asked by a team member to cover themselves or stop breastfeeding or expressing anywhere in our stores.
This includes in fitting rooms or on the shop floor.
